title: 115_hr1596
content: The Act is titled "Commission to Study the Creation of a National Museum of Irish American History" and defines terms like Commission and Museum. It establishes a Commission to study the potential creation of the National Museum of Irish American History. The Commission is established to study the potential creation of an Irish American Museum with 23 members appointed by various officials. Members must possess specific qualifications. The Commission is established to study the potential creation of an Irish American Museum with members appointed based on specific qualifications related to expertise in museum administration, fundraising, teaching Irish-American culture, and history, and experience in studying the representation of Irish-American art and culture at the Smithsonian Institution. The Commission is established to study the potential creation of an Irish American Museum. Vacancies in the Commission do not affect its powers and are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Chairperson is selected by majority vote of all members. The Commission is responsible for the duties outlined in Section 4. The Commission is tasked with submitting reports to the President and Congress regarding the establishment and maintenance of an Irish-American Museum in Washington, D.C. This includes recommendations for a plan of action, examining issues such as collection availability and impact on regional museums, and considering possible locations for the Museum. The Commission is responsible for consulting various entities on the establishment of an Irish-American Museum in Washington, D.C., including location considerations, governance structure, community engagement, and financial planning through fundraising efforts. The Commission is tasked with developing a fundraising plan for the Irish-American Museum in Washington, D.C. The plan must ensure the Museum's operations and maintenance in perpetuity without relying on Federal funds. An independent review of the plan's viability is required, including an analysis of its ability to fund construction and ongoing expenses. The Commission must submit the plan and review to the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure in the House. The Commission will provide recommendations for a legislative plan of action to create and construct the Irish-American Museum to specific committees in the House and Senate based on the report submitted. The Commission will submit final reports and plans to specific committees in the House and Senate within specified deadlines. Additionally, the Commission may host a national conference on the Museum within 18 months of selecting members. The Commission may employ an executive director and necessary personnel, with pay rates consistent with temporary organization employees. Individuals employed are not considered Federal employees. Federal agencies can provide technical assistance upon request, but no Federal employees can be detailed to the Commission. No Federal employees may be detailed to the Commission. SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS. The Commission members serve without pay but are allowed travel expenses. The Commission can accept gifts to aid its work and is not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. SEC. 7. TERMINATION. The Commission will terminate 30 days after submitting final reports and plans. Authorization for appropriations includes $2,100,000 for the first fiscal year and $1,100,000 for the second fiscal year.
